channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2023120201
item.description:
Report X-2023120201

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Odorous sticky package found in trailer. Package brought to QA for inspection. Upon inspection, internal LQ marking found. SDS Researched. Package identified as an LQ and staged in hazmat cage. DescribePack: Internal cans were crushed causing the lids of cans to fail and leak product through internal box and external box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Upon discovery of hazard, package was placed inside hazmat tote using proper PPE. Hazmat tote placed in well ventilated hazmat cage and under fume hood.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the bottom of the package getting wet. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the package was placed inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023111306
item.description:
Report X-2023111306

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC DRUM WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND DRUM WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. DRUM WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND DRUM WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2023111109
item.description:
Report X-2023111109

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED TO QA LEAKING POWDER. INSPECTION SHOWED SEEM FROM INNER PACKAGING WAS DEFECTIVE CREATING INTERNEAL AND EXTERNAL LEAKAGE. DescribePack: SEEM ALONG THE SIDE OF BODY OF PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLASTIC BAG WAS USED TO CONTAIN SPILL AND SEALED IN A HAZMAT DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023110807
item.description:
Report X-2023110807

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-06
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the package flow due to wet external box. Then it was brought to QA for inspection. There was no hazmat labeling on the package. Upon inspection, items proved to be hazardous. DescribePack: Three bottles of Husqvarna Pre-mixed 50:1 XP + fuel + oil have loose caps. Some of its content have leaked into the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was imeidetly placed inside a salvage drum after inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023110414
item.description:
Report X-2023110414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-13
  • City: EVERETT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Nov 13th this package was dropped off after being previously rejected for not having the proper marking, labels, or shippers declaration. It was suspected to be undeclared after the same customer dropped it of but the box appeared to be turned inside out. The customer dropped it off and left before the employee could stop them. Upon investigating the package it held approximately 480 small bottles of UN1263 Paint, 3, PGIII. The package is being held at the station.

  • Description: LOADER PUT PACKAGE INTO PACKAGE CAR. STARTED TO HAVE A HEAVY SMELL AND TOOK OUT OF TRUCK CALLED SUPERVISOR. THEY CALLED RESPONDER. UPON EXAMINING PACKAGE, RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONSE SHEET PROSEDURES

item.title: Report X-2023110927
item.description:
Report X-2023110927

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-10
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This package was discovered wet and torn apart. The package has no hazmat labeling on the external carton. Upon inspection package proved to contain 10 bottles of total solution drain away. DescribePack: Two bottles are missing part of their tops, two are missing, and 2 bottles have leaked some of their contents from their caps. All 10 bottles have stained labeling. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a lined bin

item.title: Report X-2023110336
item.description:
Report X-2023110336

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-21
  • City: PASCO
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Car TILX 310320 (residue propane) identified leaking in bowl track 27 by yard crew. The area was isolated and BNSF haz responders along with Graymar Env responded to assess the car. Crews found the plugs loose on the liquid line valves and vapor valve. Liquid propane was releasing through both liquid valves due to partially opened valves. The valves and plugs were secured and the car was released. All released product dissipated to atmosphere.

item.title: Report X-2023110891

Report X-2023110891

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: This was found leaking inside one of our unload trailers. This was quickly put inside a hazmat bag and bin and brought to QA to get it processed later. DescribePack: The cap on one of the bottles was loose and the seal was pulled with it. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: This was put inside a bag as soon as it was noticed and brought to QA's attention.

item.title: Report X-2023110626
item.description:
Report X-2023110626

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-07T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-30
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered by workers to be wet. Inspection revealed containers loaded upside down from "up arrows" on outside of package. 4 containers had failed caps and contents leaked. Trained personnel collected up package and processed accordingly. Although box was wet, there was no apparent spill anywhere to clean up. DescribePack: Package contained spilled liquid, with cardboard absorbing all. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Package was immediately upon discovery contained in proper Hazmat bucket and transported to Hazmat processing area.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet Box found in the hazmat cage DescribePack: Loose cap on one plastic container and it leaked inside the shipping box The liquid ate thru the box. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was put inside a plastic hazmat bag and placed in a hazmat tote under the vent in the hazmat cage.
